tool.name: CNVkit Breaks
tool.description: List the targeted genes with segmentaion breakpoint
tool.command: ln -s '$input_filename_file' ./sample.cnr && ln -s '$input_segment_file' ./sample.cns && cnvkit.py breaks ./sample.cnr ./sample.cns --output gene-breaks.txt #if $min_probes --min-probes $min_probes #end if

param.name: input_filename_file
param.label: Bin-Level log2 Ratios/Coverages cnr file
param.help: The output of the CNVkit fix

param.name: input_segment_file
param.label: CN segmentation calls cnn file
param.help: The output of the CNVkit segment

param.label: Minimum propes
param.help: Minimum number of covered probes to label a gene

tool.help:
Identify genes in which: (I) an unbalanced fusion or other structural rearrangement breakpoint occured (II) CNV calling is simply difficult due to an inconsistent copy number signal
The breaks output is a text table of tab-separated values, which is amenable to further processing by scripts and standard Unix tools such as grep, sort, cut and awk.
